bubbles1.description: We pamper ourselves by ending the day with a nice relaxing bubble bath.
bubbles1.title: Bubbles 1

bubbles2.description: And Milo just sort of floated away...
bubbles2.title: Bubbles 2

nursing.description:
Milo shares a nanny with Jordan, who has a special baby doll. Milo must have decided he needed one too, because he's been bonding with Jacob Jeremy. Here they're breastfeeding.

In case you are wondering, Lucie still nurses Milo 2 or 3 times a day. Both still enjoy it, so we don't have an exit strategy yet.
nursing.title: Nursing

owen1.description: Owen came for a sleepover.  He wasn't sure if he was actually ready to sleep away from home yet, but he packed his PJ's just in case.
owen1.title: Owen 1

owen2.description: They were adorable together.  Here they're reading Superman comics.
owen2.title: Owen 2

owen3.description: We got an ant farm for Christmas and finally mail-ordered ants for it.
owen3.title: Owen 3

owen5.description: Owen got into PJs and bedtime books were read... but when the lights went out, he decided that the sleeping over part of the sleepover wasn't such a great idea. His parents picked him up. Maybe next time, Owen!
owen5.title: Owen 5

playground.description: How do you spell Milo?  J-O-C-K.
playground.title: Playground

steinhart6.description: You know how it is.  Your brother's cuddling with Papa and you suddenly think, "I got to get me some of that."

yomama1.description: The yogababies took over our house, one afternoon. Sara Tool is pushing Felix and Argil, while Kai trots along.
yomama1.title: Yomama 1

yomama2.description: Ariel is the serious one of the group.

yomama3.description:
Maya and mom Jen (not pictured: Maya's twin brother Aidan).

Felix was a very gracious host. He gracefully let 10 toddlers ransack his room.
yomama3.title: Yomama 3

yomama4.description: Argil and two unnervingly large products from our lemon tree.
yomama4.title: Yomama 4

yomama5.description:
Saia and Ariel, actually playing together.

When it started, the yogamoms was all about the moms enjoying a social network, but now our little ones really do interact and enjoy each other's company.
yomama5.title: Yomama 5

zpring1.description: We don't know where winter went, but nobody's sent out a search party.
zpring1.title: Zpring 1

zpring2.description: Milo's been extra cuddly while sick.  We've been taking advantage of it.
zpring2.title: Zpring 2

description:
The weather has been amazing. We're wearing shorts and sandals. The trees are blooming. It's hard to believe it's February.

Felix and Milo are both sick. Milo has pink eye, which looks nasty: his eyes are bloodshot and oozing mucus. The poor munchkin's a trooper, though; he's kept his good humor except when we try to clean the goo out.

Felix recently declared that pink is his favorite color. Lucie took him clothes-shopping this week and he got really excited at the prospect of a pink outfit. The sales clerk were taken aback:

  • Lucie: Excuse me, I'm looking for a short sleeve pink T-shirt.
  • Clerk: How old is the girl?
  • Lucie: It's for my son here. He's 4.
  • Clerk: Sorry, we don't have anything.
  • Lucie: What about that one? It's pink. Is it short sleeve?
  • Clerk: This one is for girls. We sell pink clothes for girls. We don't have pink clothes for boys.
  • Lucie: What's the difference? Kids are shaped the same at that age...
  • Clerk: But look! It has a sequined heart on it!
  • Felix chimes in: I love it! That's what I've always wanted!
  • Lucie: We'll take it
  • Clerk: [look of disgust] - Whatever you say, ma'am.
His school has been excellent about it: none of his classmates have given him a hard time about the pink, or even the sequined heart. Our guess is that his classmate Amit has paved the way: he exclusively wears dresses and skirts. He even has the most adorable miniskirt that says "Party Girl".
title: February 12
